meanings.definition: The act of making something French in character or style.
meanings.sent1: The gallicizations of the restaurant's decor gave it a Parisian feel.
meanings.sent2: She studied the gallicizations in the artwork to understand the artist's inspiration.
meanings.sent3: The gallicizations of the dog's outfit made it look like a little French fashionista.
meanings.sent4: Her love for gallicizations in her home design turned her living room into a cozy French retreat.
meanings.sent5: The gallicizations of the music transported the audience to the streets of Paris.

meanings.definition: The process of adapting a word or phrase into French.
meanings.sent1: The gallicizations of English words into French can be challenging for language learners.
meanings.sent2: He specialized in gallicizations of technical terms for the French market.
meanings.sent3: The gallicizations of the menu items amused the customers with their French twist.
meanings.sent4: Her skill in gallicizations turned even the most complex terms into elegant French phrases.
meanings.sent5: The gallicizations of the novel's title added a touch of French sophistication.
